isis.stitle: Electrical System Troubleshooting Guide - BE 200, CE 200, CE 300 Model - LIGHT SYSTEMS - Red And Amber Pupil Warning Lights - Red And Amber Pupil Warning Lights Inputs To ESC From ROCKER Switches

svcproc.title: Red And Amber Pupil Warning Lights Inputs To ESC From ROCKER Switches

svcsubproc.title: Fault Detection Management

note.para: The testing method for troubleshooting the electrical systems portrayed in this manual is a basic voltage test. An alternative method of checking for voltage drops within a given circuit may be a quicker method of identifying an exact problem.
The virtual fuse in the ESC will trip during a short. To reset the fuse, the key switch must be cycled.

svcsubproc.para: A fault in the Red & Amber PWL input circuits will be apparent when the flashers and/or stop arm fail to operate. The ESC will also log a diagnostic trouble code (DTC) when there is a short in any of the red or amber pupil warning lamp circuits. Problems in the red or amber pupil warning lamp circuits can be caused by burned out lamps, a short, an open, or a problem in the ESC.

para.title: Typical Left Hand Switch Panel Rocker Switch Inputs

figure.caption: Red And Amber Pupil Warning Lights ESC Input Circuits From Left Hand Switch Panel - Always Refer to Circuit Diagram Book for Latest Circuit Information

calloutgroup.callout1: (1005) ZERO VOLT REFERENCE SPLICE CONNECTION LOCATED RIGHT SIDE INSTRUMENT PANEL
(1006) (1007) BODY BUILDER CONNECTOR LOCATED LEFT SIDE VEHICLE AT FLASHER PLATE
(1600) SYSTEM CONTROLLER LOCATED AT INSIDE RIGHT SIDE DASH PANEL
SPL-40 ZERO VOLT REFERENCE FEED SPLICE

table.title: Left Hand Switch Panel Rocker Switch Circuit Tests

entry.para: Check with ignition on and flasher switch connectors disconnected.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Test Points
Spec.
Comments
Master Flasher Switch connector C1 pin 2 to ground.
12 ± 1.5 volts
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuits 16 BLK 83 and A13AB.
Also check for blown fuse F14.
If wiring is good, replace switch.
Override Switch connector C3 pin 2 to ground.
12 ± 1.5 volts
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuits 16 BLK 83 and A13AB.
Also check for blown fuse F14.
If wiring is good, replace switch.
Master Flasher Switch connector C1 pin 5 to ground.
0 volts
If voltage is not zero, check for open or short on circuits 16 BLU 2, 16 BLU 1, A9J and A9H.
Also ensure proper zero volt reference signal from ESC connector (1600) pin 3.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: If zero volt reference signal is missing, then the ESC may need reprogrammed.
Master Flasher Switch connector C1 pin 5 to pin 6.
0 volts
If voltage is not zero, check for open or short on circuits 16 RED 30 and A89KK.
If circuits check good, then the ESC may need reprogrammed.
Flasher Start Switch connector C2 pin 5 to ground.
0 volts
If voltage is not zero, check for open or short on circuits 16 BLU 2, 16 BLU 1, A9J and A9H.
Also ensure proper zero volt reference signal from ESC connector (1600) pin 3.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: If zero volt reference signal is missing, then the ESC may need reprogrammed.
Flasher Start Switch connector C2 pin 5 to pin 6.
0 volts
If voltage is not zero, check for open or short on circuits 16 RED 39 and A89AA.
If circuits check good, then the ESC may need reprogrammed.
Override Switch connector C3 pin 5 to ground.
0 volts
If voltage is not zero, check for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 30, 16 BLU 1, A9J and A9H.
Also ensure proper zero volt reference signal from ESC connector (1600) pin 3.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: If zero volt reference signal is missing, then the ESC may need reprogrammed.
Override Switch connector C3 pin 5 to pin 6.
0 volts
If voltage is not zero, check for open or short on circuits 16 BRN 54and A89DD.
If circuits check good, then the ESC may need reprogrammed.

svcsubproc.title: Extended Description
svcsubproc.para: Power to the Master Flasher Switch and Override Switch is provided from the chassis fuse F14 through the Ign/Acc Feed SPL-20 through Ign/Acc Feed SPL-21 through connector J2 through Ign/Acc Feed SPL-22.

When the Master Flasher Switch is closed, the zero volt reference signal from the ESC connector (1600) pin 3 will pass through the zero volt reference splice connector to the zero volt reference SPL-40 through the zero volt reference SPL-41 through connector J2 through the zero volt reference SPL-42 back to the ESC connector (1600) pin 31.

When the Flasher Start Switch is closed, the zero volt reference signal from the ESC connector (1600) pin 3 will pass through the zero volt reference splice connector to the zero volt reference SPL-40 through the zero volt reference SPL-41 through connector J2 through the zero volt reference SPL-42 back to the ESC connector (1600) pin 5.

When the Override Switch is closed, the zero volt reference signal from the ESC connector (1600) pin 3 will pass through the zero volt reference splice connector to the zero volt reference SPL-40 through the zero volt reference SPL-41 through connector J2 through the zero volt reference SPL-42 back to the ESC connector (1600) pin 9.
Power to the Master Flasher Switch and Override Switch is provided from the chassis fuse F14 through the Ign/Acc Feed SPL-20 through Ign/Acc Feed SPL-21.

When the Master Flasher Switch is closed, the zero volt reference signal from the ESC connector (1600) pin 3 will pass through the zero volt reference splice connector to the zero volt reference SPL-40 through the zero volt reference SPL-41 back to the ESC connector (1600) pin 31.

When the Flasher Start Switch is closed, the zero volt reference signal from the ESC connector (1600) pin 3 will pass through the zero volt reference splice connector to the zero volt reference SPL-40 through the zero volt reference SPL-41 back to the ESC connector (1600) pin 5.

When the Override Switch is closed, the zero volt reference signal from the ESC connector (1600) pin 3 will pass through the zero volt reference splice connector to the zero volt reference SPL-40 through the zero volt reference SPL-41 back to the ESC connector (1600) pin 9.
